content.question: <math alttext="C C l 4, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> deviates more from ideal gas behavior than <math alttext="C H 4, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does. Which of the following statements best explains this observation?

choices.label: The mass of the <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule is greater than that of the <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule.

The bond energy of the <math alttext="C to C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C-C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bond is greater than that of the <math alttext="C to H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C-</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bond.

The dipole-dipole forces between <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are greater than those between <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules.

The London dispersion forces between <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are stronger than those between <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules.

content.answer: The London dispersion forces between <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are stronger than those between <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
